author: Artoo-Dion
text:
MS1 said: ↑ Jim Ryalto said: ↑ Ricardo Funes said: ↑ Youtube: 17.5M (Star Wars Main Channel) + 4.6M (Movieclips Trailers) + 0.5 (RUS) + 0.65 (BRA) + 0.19 (ES) + 0.2 (GER) + 0.18 (FRA) + 0.16 (LATAM) + 0.08 (UK) + 2M (all reaction/trailer reviews/etc) = 26M
Facebook: 26M (Main Channel) + 0.8M (GER) + 1.1M (AUS) + 1.6M (BRA) + 0.7M (ES) + 1M (FRA) + 0.4 (JAP) + 3.3 (LATAM) + 3.7 (UK) = 38.6M
I did not count other minor countries, so we can round up the Facebook views to 40M
So we have about 66M TEASER #1 (NOT A FULL TRAILER like other movies that are being compared) views in EASTER, which is a family holiday.
Also, give this trailer time and let's see how many views it will end up.
Honestly, these aren't great numbers. It's a good trailer for Star Wars fans, but it doesn't have that wow factor, that "holy **** you have got to watch this!" moment that captures the zeitgeist. I would be shocked if The Last Jedi wasn't a much better film than Thor: Ragnarok, but purely as a trailer, the Thor one is better. It has the perfect Led Zeppelin song, suggests a compelling reversal of the usual Thor storylines (hammer broken, forced to fight as a gladiator), and one really great moment that reminds everyone that this is a character they like.
Star Wars will of course be fine, but maybe the marketing team should take note that once the nostalgia factor and the "new Star Wars!" thrill wears off, people come back for the characters. the TLJ trailer was cerebral and intriguing, but it didn't have the emotional impact that really connects with general audiences. A BB-8 joke or a fun Poe and Finn moment would really go a long way here.
Your comparing Thor to StarWars? out of all the competition TLJ has this year thor is about the last one id ever be worried about.
if i recall the First TFA trailer didnt break any records. it was the last one that blew everyone away.
